name: scope: commands
description: Command logic and registration. Example: Adding `/f help`.

name: scope: events
description: Bukkit/Spigot event handlers. Example: Handling BlockBreakEvent.

name: scope: permissions
description: Permissions and role enforcement. Example: Setting up `plugin.use.fly`.

name: scope: config
description: Config options and reload handling. Example: Adding toggle for friendly fire.

name: scope: economy
description: Economy systems, Vault integration. Example: Charging for teleporting.

name: scope: integrations
description: Plugin interop. Example: Supporting WorldGuard.

name: scope: gui
description: Inventory menus and UIs. Example: Creating a faction management menu.

name: scope: api
description: Public plugin API changes. Example: Adding `Faction#getHome()`.

name: scope: player-side
description: Player-experience features. Example: Adding sounds to events.

name: scope: operator
description: Admin commands and tools. Example: Adding `/plugin reload`.

name: scope: db
description: Data storage and migration. Example: Switching from YAML to MySQL.

name: scope: docs
description: Plugin documentation. Example: Updating command list in wiki.

name: type: bug
description: A defect or error. Example: Fixing null pointer on login.

name: type: enhancement
description: Improvement to existing features. Example: Speeding up claims.

name: type: feature
description: New functionality. Example: Adding land borders.

name: type: discussion
description: Issues that are meant to spark a discussion. Example: Getting input on a future feature/api change.

name: type: documentation
description: Documentation-related changes. Example: Updating README.

name: type: refactor
description: Internal restructuring. Example: Cleaning up utilities.

name: type: test
description: Adding or improving tests. Example: Writing unit tests for API.

name: type: performance
description: Optimizing behavior. Example: Reducing lag during teleport.

name: type: security
description: Security-related update. Example: Fixing permissions escalation.

name: type: style
description: Styling or formatting only. Example: Applying code formatter.

name: status: backlog
description: Not started yet. Example: Feature request logged.

name: status: in progress
description: Currently being worked on. Example: Implementing claim preview.

name: status: blocked
description: Work cannot continue yet. Example: Waiting on Paper update.

name: status: needs review
description: Ready for code or peer review. Example: Open pull request.

name: status: needs testing
description: Requires QA or validation. Example: Manual test after merge.

name: status: ready to merge
description: Complete and approved. Example: Awaiting button press.

name: status: duplicate
description: Already tracked elsewhere. Example: Same bug in another issue.

name: status: won't fix
description: Deliberately not addressing. Example: Unsupported MC version.

name: status: invalid
description: Not actionable or incorrect. Example: Misunderstood feature.

name: effort: trivial
description: Takes <5 minutes. Example: Typo fix.

name: effort: low
description: Quick task, ~1 hour. Example: Add config toggle.

name: effort: medium
description: Moderate task. Example: Add GUI menu.

name: effort: high
description: Complex, several hours. Example: Rewrite claim system.

name: effort: very high
description: Major or multi-day task. Example: DB migration.

name: effort: unknown
description: Needs investigation. Example: Vague bug.

name: platform: spigot
description: Targets Spigot. Example: Legacy method support.

name: platform: paper
description: Targets Paper. Example: Using async chunk loading.

name: platform: sponge
description: Targets Sponge. Example: Sponge API usage.

name: platform: hybrid
description: Cross-platform support. Example: Shared plugin logic.

name: platform: fabric
description: Targets Fabric. Example: Using mixins.

name: platform: neoforge
description: Targets NeoForge. Example: NeoForge-specific hooks.

name: mc: 1.8
description: Supports Minecraft 1.8. Example: Compatibility for 1.8 features.

name: mc: 1.9
description: Supports Minecraft 1.9. Example: Compatibility for 1.9 features.

name: mc: 1.10
description: Supports Minecraft 1.10. Example: Compatibility for 1.10 features.

name: mc: 1.11
description: Supports Minecraft 1.11. Example: Compatibility for 1.11 features.

name: mc: 1.12
description: Supports Minecraft 1.12. Example: Compatibility for 1.12 features.

name: mc: 1.13
description: Supports Minecraft 1.13. Example: Compatibility for 1.13 features.

name: mc: 1.14
description: Supports Minecraft 1.14. Example: Compatibility for 1.14 features.

name: mc: 1.15
description: Supports Minecraft 1.15. Example: Compatibility for 1.15 features.

name: mc: 1.16
description: Supports Minecraft 1.16. Example: Compatibility for 1.16 features.

name: mc: 1.17
description: Supports Minecraft 1.17. Example: Compatibility for 1.17 features.

name: mc: 1.18
description: Supports Minecraft 1.18. Example: Compatibility for 1.18 features.

name: mc: 1.19
description: Supports Minecraft 1.19. Example: Compatibility for 1.19 features.

name: mc: 1.20
description: Supports Minecraft 1.20. Example: Compatibility for 1.20 features.

name: mc: 1.21.1
description: Supports Minecraft 1.21.1. Example: Compatibility for 1.21.1 changes.

name: mc: 1.21.2
description: Supports Minecraft 1.21.2. Example: Compatibility for 1.21.2 changes.

name: mc: 1.21.3
description: Supports Minecraft 1.21.3. Example: Compatibility for 1.21.3 changes.

name: mc: 1.21.4
description: Supports Minecraft 1.21.4. Example: Compatibility for 1.21.4 changes.

name: mc: 1.21.5
description: Supports Minecraft 1.21.5. Example: Compatibility for 1.21.5 changes.

name: work: obvious
description: Clear cause-and-effect. Best practices apply. Example: Fixing a config typo.

name: work: complicated
description: Requires analysis or expert knowledge. Example: Designing API endpoints.

name: work: complex
description: Uncertain outcomes, requires iteration. Example: Implementing new gameplay mechanic.

name: work: chaotic
description: Urgent and unclear. Example: Production server crash.

name: work: disorder
description: Unknown context. Needs clarification. Example: Unclear bug report.

name: priority: must-have
description: Critical to project success. Example: Core login system.

name: priority: should-have
description: Important but not vital. Example: Admin panel filters.

name: priority: could-have
description: Nice to have, low effort. Example: Dark mode toggle.

name: priority: won't-have (this time)
description: Not planned for this cycle. Example: Mobile app version.
